procedures.notes: LVEF 25%, severe LV dilation, moderate MR, elevated PASP 55mmHg
Right IJ, ultrasound guided, no complications

discharge_summary.text: 68M with HFrEF (LVEF 25%), HTN, DM2, CKD3 presenting with acute decompensated heart failure. Required CCU admission for IV diuresis and hemodynamic monitoring. BNP trending down from 1850 to 320. Creatinine peaked at 2.4 (cardiorenal syndrome) then improved. Echo: LVEF 25%, moderate MR, PASP 55. Discharged on GDMT (lisinopril, carvedilol, spironolactone, furosemide). Weight loss of 4.2 kg during admission. Daily weights and sodium restriction counseled.
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Cardiology follow-up in 1 week. Daily weights — call if >2 lb gain in 24 hours. Sodium <2g/day. Fluid restriction 1.5L/day. Labs (BMP, BNP) in 1 week.

clinical_scores.interpretation: High clinical risk. Urgent clinical review required.

quality_indicators.notes: High readmission risk due to prior HF admission within 30 days. AKI stage 2 during admission (Cr 1.8→2.4), resolved.

discharge_summary.text: 68M with known HFrEF and HTN presenting with HF exacerbation. Treated with IV diuresis, transitioned to oral. Weight loss 2.8 kg. Discharged on stable regimen.
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Cardiology follow-up in 2 weeks. Daily weights.

admission.diagnosis_at_admission: Sepsis secondary to urinary tract infection

procedures.notes: Left radial, for continuous BP monitoring

clinical_scores.interpretation: High risk of poor outcome. Sepsis-3 criteria met.
Very high clinical risk. Immediate emergency response.

quality_indicators.notes: Septic shock requiring vasopressors. AKI stage 3 (Cr baseline 0.9 → peak 3.1). Thrombocytopenia (possible DIC). Improving on day 3.

procedures.notes: Single drug-eluting stent to proximal LAD. Door-to-balloon time 68 min. TIMI 3 flow restored.
LVEF 40%, anterior wall hypokinesis, no MR, no pericardial effusion

discharge_summary.text: 45M presenting with acute anterior STEMI. Primary PCI with DES to LAD performed with door-to-balloon time 68 min. Troponin I peaked at 45.2. Post-PCI LVEF 40%. Started on DAPT (aspirin + ticagrelor), high-dose statin, beta-blocker, ACE inhibitor. LDL 165 — aggressive lipid management needed. HbA1c 5.8% (prediabetic range). Cardiac rehab referral placed.
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Cardiology follow-up in 1 week. Cardiac rehab referral. Do NOT discontinue ticagrelor for at least 12 months. Repeat echo in 3 months. Lifestyle modifications: exercise, low-fat diet, smoking cessation (if applicable).

quality_indicators.notes: Low risk. Door-to-balloon <90 min. All GDMT initiated.

admission.diagnosis_at_admission: Acute COPD exacerbation with hypercarbic respiratory failure

procedures.notes: BiPAP 12/5, FiO2 28%. Patient tolerated well. Weaned off after 48 hours.

discharge_summary.text: 71F with severe COPD (GOLD III) presenting with acute exacerbation and hypercarbic respiratory failure. Managed with BiPAP in MICU for 57 hours, systemic steroids, nebulizers, and azithromycin. ABG improved from pH 7.26/pCO2 72 to 7.38/50. Successfully weaned to room air with SpO2 93%. Discharged on prednisone taper and optimized inhaler regimen. Smoking cessation counseling reinforced.
discharge_medications: prednisone 40mg PO daily x 3 more days
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Pulmonology follow-up in 1 week. Smoking cessation program referral. PFTs in 6 weeks. Pneumococcal and influenza vaccination if not current.

clinical_scores.interpretation: High clinical risk. Urgent clinical review.

quality_indicators.notes: Avoided intubation with BiPAP. High readmission risk due to severe COPD and ongoing smoking.

procedures.notes: Grade II esophageal varices with active oozing. 3 bands placed. No gastric varices. Portal hypertensive gastropathy.
procedures.outcome: Successful variceal band ligation, hemostasis achieved

discharge_summary.text: 58M with alcoholic cirrhosis (Child-Pugh B, MELD 18) presenting with acute variceal bleeding. Hemoglobin nadir 6.8. Resuscitated with 2 units pRBC, octreotide drip, and prophylactic ceftriaxone. Emergent EGD with successful variceal band ligation (3 bands). No rebleeding. Started on nadolol for secondary prophylaxis. MELD score 18 — hepatology referral for transplant evaluation. Active alcohol use counseling provided.
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Hepatology in 1 week. Repeat EGD in 2 weeks for re-banding. Alcohol abstinence program enrollment. No NSAIDs or aspirin.

quality_indicators.notes: High readmission risk (active alcohol use, cirrhosis). Variceal rebleeding risk ~60% without secondary prophylaxis.

procedures.notes: Bilateral PE: multiple filling defects in segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries. RV/LV ratio 1.3. No saddle PE.
Acute DVT in left popliteal and femoral veins. Non-compressible.

discharge_summary.text: 34F presenting with pleuritic chest pain and dyspnea. CTA confirmed bilateral submassive PE (elevated troponin, RV strain on CT). Left leg DVT on duplex US. Risk factors: OCP use, recent 14-hour flight, BMI 32. Started on IV heparin, transitioned to rivaroxaban. Troponin trending down. Hemodynamically stable throughout. OCP discontinued. Thrombophilia workup sent (Factor V Leiden, Protein C/S, antithrombin, antiphospholipid panel).
diagnoses: Left lower extremity deep vein thrombosis
discharge_medications: rivaroxaban 15mg PO BID x 21 days, then 20mg daily (minimum 3 months)
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Hematology follow-up in 2 weeks for thrombophilia workup results. Repeat echo in 3 months to assess RV function. Discontinue OCP permanently. Discuss alternative contraception. Activity as tolerated. Return if worsening dyspnea or leg swelling.

clinical_scores.interpretation: Low risk (age <80, no cancer, no CHF/COPD, HR <110 after treatment, SBP >100, SpO2 >90 after O2).

quality_indicators.notes: Submassive PE, hemodynamically stable. Good prognosis with anticoagulation.

admission.diagnosis_at_admission: Acute ischemic stroke — left MCA territory

procedures.notes: Hyperdense left MCA sign. Early loss of gray-white differentiation in left insular cortex. No hemorrhage. ASPECTS 8.
procedures.outcome: Acute left MCA ischemic stroke, no hemorrhage

procedures.notes: Door-to-needle time 42 min. NIHSS 14 (right hemiparesis, aphasia, neglect). Last known well 2.5 hours ago.
Acute left MCA infarct involving left insular cortex, frontal and temporal opercula. DWI restriction ~45mL volume. No hemorrhagic transformation.
procedures.outcome: Confirmed moderate left MCA territory infarct

discharge_summary.text: 76M with AF (subtherapeutic warfarin, INR 1.5), HTN, and DM2 presenting with acute left MCA stroke (NIHSS 14). IV tPA administered with door-to-needle 42 min. MRI confirmed moderate left MCA infarct. NIHSS improved 14→8 by day 3. Right hemiparesis improving, expressive aphasia persistent. Swallow eval: mild dysphagia, soft diet. Transitioned from warfarin to apixaban. PT/OT/SLP evaluations: requires acute rehab. Discharged to rehab facility.
discharge_medications: aspirin 81mg PO daily (to be discontinued after 90 days)
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Neurology follow-up in 2 weeks. Continue PT/OT/SLP at rehab. Repeat MRI in 3 months. Anticoagulation for AF (apixaban indefinitely). Strict BP <130/80 target.

clinical_scores.interpretation: Moderate stroke. Right hemiparesis, expressive aphasia, left gaze preference.

quality_indicators.notes: Door-to-needle <60 min achieved. NIHSS improved from 14 to 8. Discharged to acute rehab.

discharge_summary.text: 22F with T1DM presenting with severe DKA (pH 7.15, glucose 485, AG 30, BHB 7.2). Precipitated by insulin pump malfunction — patient did not recognize symptoms early. Treated per DKA protocol: IV insulin drip, aggressive IVF, potassium replacement. AG closed and pH normalized within 14 hours. Transitioned to SC insulin. HbA1c 11.8% — significant chronic hyperglycemia. Diabetes educator consulted. Insulin pump to be replaced. Endocrinology follow-up arranged.
discharge_medications: insulin glargine 18 units SC at bedtime
insulin lispro per carb counting + correction factor
discharge_summary.follow_up_instructions: Endocrinology in 1 week for pump replacement and dose optimization. Check BMP in 3 days. Download glucose data from CGM. Sick day rules education provided.

quality_indicators.notes: Severe DKA, rapid resolution. Young patient, good prognosis. Risk of recurrence if pump issues not resolved.

icd_descriptions.I11.0: Hypertensive heart disease with heart failure
icd_descriptions.N39.0: Urinary tract infection, site not specified
icd_descriptions.I21.09: ST elevation (STEMI) myocardial infarction involving other coronary artery of anterior wall
icd_descriptions.I25.10: Atherosclerotic heart disease of native coronary artery
